page.title: 03CHRIST CHURCH, KILNDOWN
page.content: The church was built in 1840, endowed mainly by Field Marshall, Viscount Beresford, of Bedgebury, one of Wellington's generals. It was changed over the next few years into an early and outstanding example of a Gothic Revival church, under the guidance of Alexander Beresford-Hope, a member of the Cambridge Camden Society, whose members believed that all churches should be built and furnished in the Gothic style. There is a church service every Sunday morning, which the local Sunday School also attend. There is also a school service each Thursday of the term. Unfortunately, the organ is falling through the floor. The Organ Fund has raised 12,000 of the 14,000 pounds needed to rebuild it. Some of the pipes were taken away on 4th. July.
